info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 04 at 6:45PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...An intense snow shower will impact portions of northwestern Mineral County through 745 PM MDT... At 644 PM MDT, We continue to track an intense snow shower over Lookout Pass, east to Taft. This shower was nearly stationary, and is creating very slick conditions and low visibility. If you plan to travel over the pass over the next hour or so, consider delaying your trip until the snow showers pass. HAZARD...Visibility one-half mile or less. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Low visibility could result in dangerous driving conditions. Locations impacted include... Taft. This includes Interstate 90 between mile markers 0 and 8. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
